newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF pays 78 bln yen to private sector in May.
newsitem.headline: MOF pays 78 bln yen to private sector in May.

text.p: Japan's Ministry of Finance (MOF) paid out 78.0 billion yen to the private sector in May through its special foreign exchange account, Bank of Japan (BOJ) data showed on Monday.
Analysts said most of the payments in May were related to the redemption of 74.0 billion yen worth of financing bills (FBs) which had been sold to the private sector.
MOF does not comment on the details of such payments.
MOF manages Japan's external reserves, which stood at $219.922 billion at the end of April.
The private-sector institutions comprise commercial banks, foreign central banks, municipal governments, public funds and quasi-governmental organisations.
